text: Esch-sur-Alzette () is a canton in the south-west of Luxembourg. Its capital is Esch-sur-Alzette. ==Geography== With an area of , and a population (2016) of 172,687, the Esch-sur-Alzette canton has a population density of inhabitants/km². The canton borders on the south with the French departments of Moselle and Meurthe-et-Moselle, and with Belgium on the west. In the Pétange commune is the point where where three countries meetː Luxembourg, France and Belgium. ==Communes== The Esch-sur-Alzette canton has 14 communes (2017 population). #Bettembourg (10,736) #Differdange (25,402) #Dudelange (20,480) #Esch-sur-Alzette (34,378) #Frisange (4,557) #Kayl (8,982) #Leudelange (2,596) #Mondercange (6,708) #Pétange (18,238) #Reckange-sur-Mess (2,397) #Roeser (6,125) #Rumelange (5,573) #Sanem (16,136) #Schifflange (10,379) ==Related pages== * Cantons of Luxembourg * Districts of Luxembourg (former) ==References== ==Other webisites==
title: Canton of Esch-sur-Alzette
